main_definition: A package refers to a bundle or collection of items, often wrapped or contained together for ease of transportation or storage.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Packaging material used to protect and contain products during shipment
meanings_and_examples.example: The electronics were carefully packaged in bubble wrap before being shipped.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A set of software or program components bundled together for easy installation and use
meanings_and_examples.example: I just installed a new package that includes the latest updates to my operating system.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A collection of goods wrapped or boxed for sale or delivery
meanings_and_examples.example: The online store offers various packages with different items, such as cosmetics and clothing bundles.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An event in which a product is introduced to the public, often involving demonstrations and promotions
meanings_and_examples.example: The company hosted a package launch for their new line of kitchen appliances.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A group or set of related items delivered together
meanings_and_examples.example: I received my daily newspaper package in the mail today.
